history.content:
You can't put all your classes P/NP for a semester or you'll be put in academic probation. Otherwise just don't let your p/np units go past 1/3 of your overall units I guess.

-------------------

If you have everything you need to graduate, you can take all classes P/NP after confirming graduation with your ESS (for CoE) advisor. 

For L&S: http://ls-advise.berkeley.edu/registration/pnp.html

You can't put all your classes P/NP for a semester or you'll be put in academic probation. Otherwise just don't let your p/np units go past 1/3 of your overall units I guess.

-------------------

If you have everything you need to graduate, you can take all classes P/NP after confirming graduation with your ESS advisor.
You can't put all your classes P/NP for a semester or you'll be put in academic probation. Otherwise just don't let your p/np units go past 1/3 of your overall units I guess.

children.subject: I got this information via email from my L&S advisor Monica Bernal a day before the p/np deadline.
I don't see anywhere where it say you can't put all your classes P/NP. The P/NP unit limit only applies to overall units taken at Cal by the time you graduate.

history.content: Can someone tell me if there's a restriction on how many classes you can take P/NP within a semester, given I have all the units/classes to graduate. I want to take 2/3 of my classes p/np this semester and i don't know if there are any major or L&S college rules against this.
history.subject: How many P/NP classes in a semester?
